wpt.name: GCVQHX
wpt.desc: Gibson's Bridge Cache by RoyalRed, Traditional Cache (3/3)

groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:name: Gibson's Bridge Cache
groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:short_description: An "Off-Shoot" of the G-Seekin" Six I See A Bridge! Seed Cache!
groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:long_description:
Parking available off Harmony Hill Road.

DO NOT ATTEMPT TO PARK ALONG ROUTE 322 OR CROSS BRIDGE FROM 322. ACCESS IS ONLY POSSIBLE FROM HARMONY HILL ROAD!

The G-Seekin' Six recently placed a "Seed" cache and this is one of its off spring. A micro container hidden at one of Chester County's covered bridges. GPS reception is not the greatest near the bridge. Reference the cited web location for additional information concerning the bridge.http://william-king.www.drexel.edu/top/bridge/CBHarmony.HTML


Click to Visit the SEPAG Homepage & Forums

EARLY SUMMER FLOOD OF 2006 UPDATE: Cache was washed away by this flood. Once you locate the cache you will see how high the water level actually was!
groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:encoded_hints: Rocks out of place near one of the bridge's tie down rods will give this one away.

groundspeak:log.groundspeak:text: Found plenty of prickers, but no cache.
Second try on this one with dawnie22. I'm sure I'll kick myself when I find it eventually.
At long last, we have the smiley!!! It only took 4 or 5 visits -- I kept looking on the wrong side. Found with dawnie22 and our girls. Thanks for the challenge.
